{"step_by_step_thinking": "Asherman syndrome is characterized by intrauterine adhesions. According to the documents, these adhesions can cause total endometrial obliteration, severe adhesions, and variable severity of uterine synechiae. Intrauterine adhesions typically result in menstrual disorders such as oligomenorrhea or hypomenorrhea. There is no mention of metromenorrhagia (heavy bleeding) or polymenorrhea (abnormal frequency) in the context of Asherman syndrome.", "answer_choice": "A"}
